Title: Senior Staff Data Scientist
JD:
About the job
    


          As a Data Scientist at ELC Online, you will be responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities using statistical and machine learning methods. You will write efficient, clear code as well as accurate, mathematically rigorous technical documents to ensure deliverables meet customer needs and team goals. You will collaborate with an interdisciplinary team of engineers, scientists, and product managers to translate business and functional requirements into concrete deliverables, including the design, development, testing, and deployment of scalable solutions. You will bring scientific rigor and structure to ambiguous business problems and address the challenges of product creation, development, and improvement with an appreciation for the behaviors and needs of our consumers. You will acquire data by exploring the universe of available data and building the necessary queries and pipelines. You will analyze data for trends and validity by inspecting distributions, exploring relationships, constructing appropriate transformations, and attributing meaning to anomalies. You will build models using statistical and machine learning methods, validate models against alternative approaches, and implement models that comply with the computational demands, accuracy, and reliability of the relevant processes at various stages of production. You are an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical audiences. You tackle intrinsically difficult problems; you are interested in learning and will acquire skills and expertise as needed.
Utilize code (python, etc.) and apply statistical /machine learning expertise to solve business problems. Develop scalable tools to drive automation and optimize business operations. Develop ML-driven systems to expand capabilities and facilitate analysis within a given domain such as campaign effectiveness and incrementality, planning and forecasting, personalization, recommendation engines, pricing, fraud, and customer support. Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods as needed. Conduct analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations Build analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive knowledge of ELC data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed for product development Maintain standards for writing clean, organized machine learning code and documentation to streamline machine learning workflow. Provide subject matter expertise and mentorship for junior data science professionals to deliver data-driven solutions in support of established roadmaps. Manage and continuously improve business user’s experience with data, including exploratory data analysis, data visualization, advanced modeling, and communication of applicable insights to audiences at varying levels of technical sophistication. Develop partnerships with engineering and product teams to deliver on major cross-functional automation, measurement, testing, and modeling efforts. Actively participate in ELC’s diversity and inclusion agenda. 
Qualifications

Qualifications
BS/BA in a quantitative field; a plus if MS degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering) or equivalent practical experience. 1+ years of experience (may be substituted with a graduate degree) in Analytics, Data Science or Software Engineering; including expertise with statistical data analysis such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, sampling methods Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch 1+ years of experience with data scripting languages or statistical/mathematical software (Python, R, Matlab, etc.) and database languages (SQL, etc.) Track record of delivering data-driven products and insights. Experience deploying and managing production-grade “Big Data” systems. Knowledge of best practices in large- and small-scale data processing Proficiency in data structure & algorithm design. Hands-on experience in advanced machine learning topics including natural language processing, computer vision, or advanced statistical methods Experience with statistical modeling, hypothesis testing, and experimentation. 
Differentiating Benefits
Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance Extensive Paid Parental Leave Learning & Education Assistance Student Loan Contributions PTO for Volunteer Work Adoption Assistance Child and Elder Care Assistance Generous 401(k) Savings Plan and match Stock Purchase Programs Quarterly Product Allowance Employee Discounts Pension Plan/Retirement Growth Account

Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Director, Data Science at The Estée Lauder Companies Inc.
Title: Director, Data Science
JD:
About the job
    


          The Estée Lauder Companies (ELC) Inc. is a Fortune 500, multinational manufacturer and marketer of prestige skincare, makeup, fragrance and hair care products, headquartered in New York City. As the global leader in prestige beauty, we touch over half a billion consumers a year. The company owns a diverse portfolio of brands, distributed internationally through both digital commerce and retail channels.

Key Activities
 Working hands on daily with code, IDEs, data warehouses, data lakes, and engineering tools to support business objectives Developing, maintaining, and contributing to internal code bases with best practices in mind Creating ETLs, Feature Stores, and Production data pipelines for source or external sources to support projects Automating, modularizing, and optimizing redundant data science workflows supporting project builds Documentation and diagraming in detail for solution workflows Working with business teams / stakeholders to explain and ensure the pipelines/calculations are in-line with expectations Building End-to-End solutions from scoping to production deployment Working to support data scientists / ML engineers in the data ops part of analytical life cycles
Qualifications

Technical Skills and Qualifications
 Knowledge of one or more programming languages (Python, Spark, PySpark, Julia, SQL) Knowledge of software lifecycles and best practices in the programming language of choice Knowledge of short- and long-term sustainable ML systems Masters Degree in a quantitative field preferred (in one of the above or equivalent)
Behavioral Skills
 Strong business acumen and customer service attitude Ability to manage multiple projects and operational tasks simultaneously Strong intrapersonal skills, teamwork mindset, and ability to work cross-functionally Effective problem-solving capabilities; Find interesting to dig in the details / mechanics of a problem Solution focused approach
Functional Skills
 Experience working on one or more cloud platforms (Azure, GCP, AWS) Deep expertise in one of the languages (Python, Spark, PySpark, Scala, SQL, Julia) Working within notebook & IDE environments (Databricks, JupyterLab, RStudio, PyCharm, Spyder, DataGrip) Experience hands-on with DataOps (Preparation, QA, Staging, Validations, Lineage, Profiling, Tracking) Experience using one or more of the following tools (Databrick, Snowflake, SageMaker, Hbase, Hadoop, Airflow) Experience using GitHub, bitbucket, (or others) and version control Experience with Tableau, PowerBI, or related software Experience with developing production end-to-end solutions Experience or knowledge of feature stores (Feather, Feast, Hopworks, Delta Lakehouse) Understanding / Hands on use of Azure Synapse, DBX Warehouses, Oracle, Delta Lakehouse, ALDS, DBFS) Ability to tie loose ends together for solutions across systems Knowledge using and building custom APIs
Nice to Haves
 Experience using Azure Data Factory (ADF) Experience using KubeFlow or Azure ML Studio Understanding of Statistical and Machine learning workflows Understanding of DevOps and MLOps workflows
